articles.content:
S. Korean ruler urged to fulfil promises
      Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) on July 15 held a press conference and urged the present South Korean ruler to fulfil his promises including an issue of releasing all arrested workers, according to a report.
   The KCTU asserted that at a talk with the chairmen of two trade unions -- the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of (South)  Korean Trade Unions -- on June 30, Kim Dae Jung clearly promised release of those arrested, lifting of search, probe into the truth behind the suppression of Seoul subway and mint company trade unions, eradication of unreasonable labour actions and observation of collective contracts, but they have not been fulfilled till now.     
   The KCTU warned that if the present "government" doesn't move to keep the promises, it will wage an all-out struggle including the struggle for the resignation of the "government".
